TopicTitle: Extend "target velocity" Indicator to include bodies, not just spacecraft

Articles.Content:
It might be useful to know your velocity relative to a "moon" and/or Sun well your craft is currently in the sphere of Influence of a different body... 

I'm not sure if it is as easy as including on the nav ball the target mode if you set a certain body (Including possibly the main body the Sun) as the target on your

active vessal. Also might be cool if for body's the nav ball would also show the orbital directions {prograde, radial, normal, etc} relative for the targeted body when set to target mode, would help greatly to synchronize orbital velocity for the moons with a very small sphere of influence.

I believe I added a setting for this in 1.0.5 anyway.

Add

celestialBodyTargetingMode = DirectionAndVelocity

to Physics.cfg and that should do it.

Hi Nathan,

you are saying if we add those lines to the Phsyics.cfg we get another readout on the Navball?

That line only, but yes, I'm saying if you add that line, and target another body (i.e. not your reference body), and switch to target mode on the navball, you'll get a velocity readout per the OP's wishes.
